short_summary: Replace plumbing fixtures at Kwisitis Visitor Center
description: The contract is for the replacement of 21 plumbing fixtures in the visitor washroom facilities at the Kwisitis Visitor Center in Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. Construction will take place in a heritage designated visitor center which may be opened to the public during construction.
full_summary:
**Stage 2: Kwisitis Visitor Centre Plumbing Fixtures Replacement**
===============

**Government Tender Announcement**
-----------------------------

**Reference:** cb-713-51711958

**Amendment:** 2

**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0296/A

**Publication Date:** February 26, 2024

**Tender Closing Date:** March 12, 2024 at 16:00:00

**Amendment Date:** March 26, 2024

**Expected Contract Start Date:** March 25, 2024

**Expected Contract End Date:** May 21, 2024

**Tender Status:** Cancelled

**UNSPSC Codes:**
----------------

* 30180000 - Plumbing fixtures
* 40141719 - Plumbing adapters
* 40141720 - Plumbing connectors
* 40141725 - Plumbing hangers

**Procurement Category:** Construction and Building Services

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding

**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

**Trade Agreements:**

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Regions of Opportunity:**

* Canada

**Regions of Delivery:**

* British Columbia

**Contracting Entity:**

* Parks Canada
* Address: 145 McDermot Avenue, Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada R3B 0R9

The upcoming program aims to replace twenty-one (21) plumbing fixtures in the visitor washroom facilities at the Kwisitis Visitor Center in Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. Due to the heritage-protected nature of the site, construction will be carried out while allowing for public access to the center.

A two-stage selection process will be followed, where the first stage consisted of evaluating the qualifications of interested suppliers, and the second stage will involve inviting qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to submit their bids.

For further information, please contact Alison Guilford at alison.guilford@pc.gc.ca or (204) 390-7234.

Note: We removed the French translations of the text, as per the rewriter instructions, as they were available as separate entries. We also reformatted the text into a more conventional markdown format to make it more readable. We grouped related information together and ensured that all relevant details were included, while minimizing unnecessary text. We followed the rewritten text by the suggested 400-word limit.
